name: Rita Bowman Lobster Casserole (From Ann Navage)
ingredients: 1 12 oz. Package langostino (or shrimp or lobster meat)
1 whole filet salmon (1 side of fish)
6 plum tomatoes,  seeds out, cut small, cook in butter and garlic until saucy
1/3 cup shredded scallions or chopped onions
1 small jar lachoy sweet & sour sauce
1 can hunts whole tomatoes – cut up
3 or 4 slices white bread w. crust
3 large can jars Barilla marinara sauce
¼ cup wine or beer (your choice)
instructions: Steam 4 at a time for 9 minutes
Season with salt & pepper and some cayenne pepper (little bit)
Pour in casserole, top with breadcrumbs
In saucepan, melt margarine over low heat
Bring to a boil and stir until slightly thickened
Alternate cracker crumbs, langostino mixture and grated cheese
Chopped raw shrimp, scallops or crab meat

Add 2 cups crushed Ritz crackers & Bremmer wafers, parsley, dill, salt & pepper, chopped raw shrimp, scallops or crab meat. I usually combine shrimp & scallops but if you don’t like them use lump crab.
Tap cracker crumb mixture onto salmon.
Wrap in foil & bake at 325 until salmon is cooked.  It takes some time because the salmon is thick. About 1 hour
Mince or finely chop celery, shallot, green & red pepper
Sauté celery, shallot, and peppers in large chunk butter
When cooled, add to crab meat
Add mayonnaise, crushed Ritz crackers, and Bremmer wafers (at least 1 sleeve of crackers).
Add salt & pepper, minced fresh parsley, dill, and chive.
You want mixture wet enough to form cakes but not too wet
Dust each crab cake in fresh Pepperidge farm breadcrumbs
Lightly fry in butter (can add a little oil so butter doesn’t burn)
Serve with cocktail sauce and tartar sauce
Filet of sole (very thin - 2 pieces per person)
Wash fish with water dry with paper towel
In a bowl, beat eggs, pour some bread crumbs on a plate.
Dip fish in egg mixture, then into bread crumbs
Spray cookie sheet with Pam and place fish on it
Place fish in single layer on sheet
Slice tomatoes, onion, green pepper thin and place on top of fish. Add parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper
You can substitute cookie pan for heavy duty foil and cook on gas grill.
Put salmon in large deep fry pan or Dutch oven
Cover with water to almost above salmon
Add carrots, onion, celery, dill weed, and bay leaf
Turn on medium heat and simmer until salmon turns light pink.
Butter and garlic in frying pan
Throw in some ground up fresh basil and parsley
Make Parma Rosa Sauce, (double the butter) and add it to the tomato sauce
Blanche bunch of asparagus , cut in 1” pieces
Cook shrimp in butter & garlic sauce ,  put in shredded lobster tail meat
Add shrimp or lobster to parmesan sauce
Cook 2 packages of bow tie pasta
AUNT RAINY FALVEY’S SCALLOPED POTATOES AND HAM
Melt butter in a medium size saucepan
Cook and stir over low heat until thickened
Season to taste with salt and pepper
Butter a 2 ½ qt. casserole dish.
Add potatoes, onions, and ham to dish in layers
Pour sauce over potatoes and ham
Cover and bake at 350 degrees for ¾ hour
Uncover and bake until potatoes are tender
Layer slices of potato, slivers of butter, onion, salt and pepper to taste, ham chunks, flour
SANDRA WOLFF’S SWEET & SOUR PORK (CHICKEN & SHRIMP ALSO GOOD)
Pork Tenderloin – bake at 400 for 45 minutes.
Chicken – cook until juices are clear.
Raw Shrimp – clean and add to sauce and cook approx. 5-7 minutes (until shrimp are cooked).  The shrimp gets tough if cooked too long.
Vegetables – I use baby carrots, onion (quartered), green peppers and sliced mushrooms
Pre-cook all of them except mushrooms and then add to the sauce
Add bite size pieces of pork or chicken and heat through
Serve over fried rice or regular rice.
Heat oil in large frying pan
Let it marinate for at least 3 hours.
Cut kielbasa into large pieces; parboil 10-15 minutes
Mix other ingredients in casserole dish
Add kielbasa slices & stir to cover with sauce
Cover and bake at 350 for 1 hour or microwave on high approximately 8-10 minutes.
Rinse off ribs with water, pat dry.  place in tin
Cover tin with foil and place in oven
Raggazino (no longer makes sauce, need to substitute a different brand) spaghetti sauce and
Combine and simmer for a few hours
Add meatballs about 1 hour before serving
Mix salt and pepper, egg, and beef w/ hands – let sit – ½ hour
bake 350 – about 1 hour 15 minutes for meatloaf
Cook spaghetti pasta in 5 cups of boiling water, cook 3 to 5 minutes (al Dente)
Drain spaghetti in a colander then toss with the tomato soup (set aside)
When meat is all cooked add 4 to 5 cups of pasta sauce
Now prepare the casserole in a round casserole dish by alternating the ingredients – pasta, sauce and then cheese
Finish with grated cheese on top
Bake in the oven (400 degrees) for 20 to 25 minutes
Cheese on top should be slightly browned and bubbling.
Put in food processor – add to sauce
Mix all cheeses into a bowl
Add sauce to bottom of pan and layer noodles, sauce, and cheese until finished
Add parmesan cheese to the top when finished.
Bake at 350 for 1 hour until bubbly
Let rest for 15 minutes before cutting.
Small amount of fresh chopped garlic
Add above items (except onion and garlic) into pot, put on low
Fry onions in oil and chopped garlic until onions are clear
Optional: If using hot sausage also, cut hot into large pieces, sweet into small pieces in order to tell difference
Bake at 325 for 15 minutes Turn and bake another 15 minutes Place cut sausage in sauce and cook slowly about 2 hours
If any liquid is left, add to sauce.

metadata.originalTitle: RITA BOWMAN LOBSTER CASSEROLE (FROM ANN NAVAGE)
